page.title: 11FARMING IN GRANTHAM
page.content: The NE area under survey offers a complete cross section through the Witham Valley and its eastern slope and divides into several distinct farming landscapes. In the valley bottom between Manthorpe and Belton the low lying land is wet and in places quite heavy. Pasture and meadows are found here. On the valley side sand and gravel terrace, near Manthorpe, a market gardener has established a small but popular holding and also engages in contract farm & garden work. From Belton village towards Londonthorpe and Harrowby Hill the pasture is grazed by cattle and sheep. In places root crops and a few grains plus new crops like rape, have been planted.On the Harrowby estate there are some crops grown under glass in the farmer's nursery.
